column2: siblings=Two unnamed sisters<ref name="Mark"/><ref group="note">Under [[Fengel]] in [[Appendix A]] it states: "Thengel, his third child and only son, left Rohan when he came to manhood and lived long in Gondor, and won honour in the service of Turgon."</ref>

column5: n}}, aged 75 years) was the sixteenth [[King of Rohan]]. Thengel was the only son of [[Fengel]], and became king after the death of his father in {{TA

column1: Fengel was a greedy and quarrelsome man, and Thengel left Rohan in his youth to live in [[Gondor]], where he won great renown in the service of [[Turgon (Steward of Gondor)
column2: Turgon]]. Eventually he met and married [[Morwen Steelsheen]] of [[Lossarnach]] in {{TA
column4: n}}, and he lived with her there for a while. Morwen bore him five children in total, including his only son (his second child) [[Théoden]] in {{TA
column7: 2963}}, who would be the mother of [[Éomer]] and [[Éowyn]].<ref name="Mark">{{App

column2: 2953}}, Thengel was called upon to return to Rohan, which he reluctantly did. During Thengel's reign, a mysterious Northerner calling himself [[Thorongil]] entered his service, and rode with him for some time.<ref>{{App
column3: Stewards}}</ref> [[Saruman]] took [[Isengard]] for himself and began to fortify it.<ref name="Mark"/>

column2: Sindarin]] while living in Gondor, and in his house it was the daily tongue, together with [[Westron]], the common speech. Even after his return, he continued to use Westron,<ref>{{PM
column3: Dwarves}}</ref> and [[Rohirric]] was not spoken by him or his heirs.<ref name="Mark"/>

column1: '''Þengel''' in [[Old English]] means "lord" and derives from ''þeġen, þegn''. This word is also related to [[Thain]].
